description.narrative: Nigeria has experienced continued rainfall since July. Many states have been affected with unprecedented high-water levels. The Government of Nigeria announced a state of emergency in the four worst affected states of Kogi, Niger, Anambra and Delta. The flood alert released by Nigeria Hydrological Services Agency (NIHSA) indicated that states and communities by the banks of River Niger and Benue may experience further flooding due to a systematic daily rise in the water levels from both major rivers that cut Nigeria into almost two equal parts: Niger and Benue. In addition, more rainfall has been predicted. States that are at risk, or further risk are those adjacent to River Niger and Benue which are Kebbi, Niger, Kwara, Kogi, Edo, Anambra, Rivers, Delta, Bayelsa, Adamawa, Taraba, Benue and Nasarawa.
